Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: AyanLondon
Reviews.Content: Well this was my 1st budget hotel I have stayed and to be honest my cousin and myself were really suprised how clean, airy and confortable the place was....Seeing the previous reviews I was panicking and having second thought about it, but we decided to stick to it and to be honest it is definetly a place i will stay again for the price..Some of the staff were friendly and helpful especially sean at the fron desk and for the price we hav paid I can't complain....By the looks of it they hav refurbished the place, its in the perfect location the stion its 2 minutes walk and all the local shops and restraurant are at our door step..Anyone who is on a budget should defitetly stay at the mount royal.....

Reviews.Title: “Only If You are feeling Brave”
Reviews.Author: Tuggster
Reviews.Content: A Week there, 1st time in NYC sdo knew no better, certainly learnt from the experience. Though we had no problems, except the lock on our door was faulty and reported to the staff on the 1st day, nothing done for the week we were there, i would not recommend this place for anyone expecting anything short of a place to sleep for the night.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever..”
Reviews.Author: manksu
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" was a worst place I have ever been to. Thank god we only booked 2 nights from our weeks holiday. Room was really filthy, unsafe in many ways, the bed was too small for 2 and linens were disgusting. Some really strange people hang in the hallways and in the night time somebody was trying to get in to our room. And the door..it was not very strong. There was also "lovely" smell in closet (we think it was urine). I could not use the toilet (shared) because it was so dirty. I had to leave early in the morning to the restaurant nearby to have some breakfast and at the same time use the toilet. The whole experience was horrible. I could not recommend this place to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not great”
Reviews.Author: Quaddles
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed here on our first trip to NYC last year. As students, we wanted something fairly cheap, and since we were only there for the weekend, did not need luxury. It was definitely not the nicest or fanciest place I have stayed but it worked for us. Room: our room had two double beds and we had a shared washroom with the floor. The room was small but decent and had a working air conditioner/fan. I did bring my own sheets, however. Over the two days we spent there a large wet spot accumulated on our floor - we never did figure out what it was, simply covered it with a comforter. The washrooms were clean enough (minus the shower), however be prepared to wait in line unless you want to get up and ready really early (before 7:30). Security: the biggest problem I had with this hotel was how unsafe I felt. Had not I been so exhausted from the trip each night I'm sure I would not have slept. The door was no thicker than an interior bedroom door in a house. It did not even actually latch, so unless it was locked it did not stay closed. The lock looked like it would pop right off with a good shoulder to the door from the outside. We returned both nights after midnight, and while staff were still on duty, we were not required to check in or show ID or anything. We were allowed to walk right in, no questions asked. We did find it a little loud, however we were right near the fire exit so all of the smokers tended to pass by our room. We were actually woken up one night by screaming outside our door. A little scary when there is no phone in the room to potentially call for help. Location: as has been mentioned in other reviews, the location was beautiful. The streets were actually tree-lined, there is a large park area nearby and it is right near the subway station. A little tricky to find by car for anyone driving in (we spent about 2 hours driving around lost), because of all the one-way streets. Parking is not available on site and is about 30 dollars a day. Overall, despite all the bad things about this hotel, it served our purpose. I would recommend it for only short stays where you do not plan to spend any time lounging in the hotel and will be too tired at the end of the day to notice its flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Any other budget hotel BUT this!”
Reviews.Author: freebird74
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st budget hotel experience and the worst of its kind in NYC! I thought ALL budget hotels in NY were like it and glad tried 2 others recently (Look for Belnord Hotel and Grant Hotel) so now I could really make a comparison. For the price, you get what you pay for!! BUT in the 2 other hotels that I mentioned, they're far better than Mount Royal for the same price!! With that given, compared to the 2 others, Mount Royal is soo old it looks like it's gonna fall apart any minute. The sheets are old, thin, rough and really something I would NOT consider beddings. Don't even use their towels. We brought in our own towels and beddings. It's hard to sleep when you're thinking of bugs or what could be crawling underneath that old beat up bed. The venyl flooring was dirty and old and peeling. The one we stayed at had no airconditioner, only a fan. The bathrooms are relatively new but not well maintained. There are no mirrors anywhere. Going through the halls, you'd get a glimpse of how old the building is. The elevator was a scary ride- would rather use the stairs... Because I stayed at 2 other hotels for the same price recently, I had to give it a terrible rating-otherwise it's okay if you can't book anywhere else. You'd survive a day or two there once in your life and then you could say- never again!! (It's funny because Mount Royal is almost just fronting Grant Hotel- they're the same price range BUT Grant Hotel certainly has above average accommodation!)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is illegal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mont Royal Hotel is actually classifed by the City of New York as a SRO. It is supposed to provide housing for the poor. The owner, Fitos Neophytou, is being sued by the Dept of Housing for "illeaglly converting the SRO to a hotel and advertising it". His buildings are rife with housing code violations, many pertaining to lack of smoke alarms and inadequate fire escape routes. See the July 5 issue of "The Village Voice" where Mr Neophytou is featured as one of the 10 worst landlords in NYC. Please enjoy your stay in NYC and find a better place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, well located basic hotel and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Seb3343
Reviews.Content: My girldfriend and I stayed in this Hotel during 3 nights. At our arrival, the staff was unfriendly and, as indicated on their website, they do not accept credit cards. Instead you have to use the ATM located in the lobby. The hotel is old, not very well maintained and has been repainted tens of times. Floors are covered with old brown carpets. The bathrooms are in quite bad condition but we always had hot water. The room was big and was equiped with an AC system (noisy). In conclusion, this is a relatively cheap hotel for people who are not expecting any luxury. I would classify it as a old youth hostel. The hotel is quite well located though, only 2 blocks away from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reserving a room for one night online 2 weeks prior to arrival.... we were excited to go. when we arrived front desk was rude, asked us for ID and then denied us our reserved room because we were from new york... how can someone be denied if it was pre-reserved? they said they didn't serve in state people.... I never read such a thing on their site... they claimed that they didn't take our money that was charged.... but when in fact we called our agent and found they did take our money... protocal was taken and money was returned.... trust me... just save yourself all the hassel... the cheap rates of this hotel is not worth the rudeness and dump of a stay in the city. The comfort Inn up the block was so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand why there are people that have the nerve to rate this hotel/hostel as excellent! They must be friends with the owner. Also it's nonsense to remind people that they shoul'dn't expect much because it's a hostel. True, you can't expect luxury for this price, but even a hostel has to be clean! The only thing that looked clean here were the marble steps leading to the entrance. The stairs inside were made of the same marble, but only unrecognizable due to all the dirt. The room was completely bare, and stank, even the matrass stank. There wasn't even a hook to hang your towel on, well I did find a nail protruding from the wall which I used..., or a waste basket. The room itself did look like a waste basket though. The carpet was filthy, and there simply were piles of dust on the heating, which of course didn't work even though it was freezing cold in the room. Also you have the chance to get up really early... to really make something of your day... because the blinds don't close completely, which also robbed us from any privacy. Then again even if they would have shut completely, they still would have let all the light through. Thank god we only had to stay here for one night, since our hotel was overbooked. We booked the Apollo Inn, in Harlem, which obviously belongs to the same owner, only this hotel is clearly in an 'after renovation state', instead of the Mount Royal Pain in the Ass where they are just starting. I hope...Even though the neighbourhood is less friendly, this hotel was a relief. You either have to close completely if you're renovating, or stay open but still take good care of your guests, otherwise you're just out to take people for their money for which they get nothing in return. If I pay for something, no matter how much or little, I expect at least to be treated like a human being, and this was simply degrading and insulting. Please do not forget to look at my pictures to verify if I'm telling the truth....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly i stayed here for one week - one week to long!! The room was small and dirty, the door did not lock properly and the cooking smells that came through my door from the people who actualy 'LIVE' in this hotel were disgusting. This hotel used to be an apartment block - SRO'S, and some of the tenants still live here. The bed was not clean, I had a few bug bites and the front desk did not seem to care.The bathrooms were not the cleanest - take your own loo roll...I would rather stay on Rikers Island Prison than here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but not for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Boesgaard
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in New York with my girlfriend. We found the hotel easily, and the location is quite nice, only two blocks away from the metro. It is also close to a Starbucks, McDonalds, subway (sandwichbar), Dunkin Donuts and Duane Reade. Our (first) room (no. 624) was very small, and placed right next to the bathrooms. The room was not that clean, and there were hair on the sheets. We had to ask three days in a row, before the sheets were changed. We also asked for the towels to be changed, but it was on the third day we were told that we would have to have our towels replaced at the reception. The bathrooms were cleaned at least two times everyday. The problem was that not all guest would respect that they were shared - we often find urine on the toilet-seat. Some of the rooms were occupied by permanent residents, with whole familys inside. These people were quite noisy, and let their kids play around outside the rooms even quite late in the evening. One night we woke up because of strange noises from the walls. Turning on the light revealed that there had been some kind of damage to a waterpipe, and there was water coming out from the walls. My duffle-bag had quite a lot of water on it, but fortunately I had it closed. The next morning we asked for a new room , and was told to come back a 9 in the morning. We got a new room on the first floor (no 114), which was much nicer than our first room. The second room had a desk, and much more space. The people in the reception was kind and polite. Even though this place is inexpensive, I think it is too expensive compared to what you get. If you can afford it, spend $20-30 more a night and get something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Lets clear the air”
Reviews.Author: travel4aliving
Reviews.Content: this was my 3rd time at this hotel/hostel. I read all teh reviews, but booked anyway, because of my previous 2 experiences at this place. My first wasnt the best, but i learned from it. Mount royal is a HOTEL AND HOSTEL. do your research if you dont know what a hostel is. If you expect to spend all your vacation in a room then book elsewhere, but i fyou need a clean and comfortable place to sleep/shower/etc, then book Mount royal. They have rooms with private bathroms, and much cheaper rooms with shared bathrooms. You get what you pay for. No full service here, but the place is clean, neighborhood is very safe, beautiful park and river, and subway ar a block away. they also arrange transportation for you, which is very inexpensive ( shuttle). If you want your own bath - book a private room, if you want a place to sleep - book a shared room. No matter which way you look at it - it IS A BARGAIN for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “it's a swindling !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've never get ripped off like that ! I've book through internet a couple of days before but when we arrived, the hostel was overbooked. They proposed us one stinky room in a third building on construction, without any sheet, no paint on the wall, big holes on the floor... Just incredible and unacceptable ! Of course we paid to book and couldn't get the money back !

Reviews.Title: “Never ever ever ever ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi me and my mate stayed here for 5 nights (thank god it was only that) in february. First impressions were not bad then we got to our room(a small cupboard and found out that they had given us a double bed even tho we stated when we booked that we needed two singles. The people at reception were very helpful and chatty, they gave us a new room the next day which i was relieved about as the floor we were staying in smelt of pork or someone cooking noodles all the time!!!!!! we got moved to the 7th floor and had our own bed even tho it was a bunk bed that made so much noise!!! Everything is dull at the hotel, the walls are covered in a thick layer of paint and the decor is boring. Now the bathrooms were a different matter, they were hardly cleaned and very bare. They are shared between four rooms and the families that live there (its also a hostel) let their kids use them without supervision. I can say that i will never stay in a hotel like this again!!! its true that you get what you pay for however i did not pay to walk on dirty urine splashed floors with body hair scattered in places and shower in a rusted tub!!! (i dreaded using the bathrooms so i used to sneak down stairs and use the ground floor ones!!!) On a plus side you are right next to broadway and not to far from central park. Plenty of food places around the area, my favourite was Arties 255 West.83 St. very nice food! The subway is round the corner and only takes 5 mins to reach Times square. I also noticed that in the upper west side there is alot of dog mess on the streets! what is up with that! Excellent break apart from the accomadation and the freezing cold weather!!! Roll on next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the cheapest possible on Manhattan (as far as I know), and the best possible for the price. The rooms can be small, but they are clean; the bathrooms are well taken care of; the staff is friendly; the location is also great, as the hotel is a block and a half from a subway station. If you are looking for the hostel feel, this isn't the place to be because it's structured like a hotel, but it's quiet and can be wonderful substitute for a regular hotel. I was with my boyfriend and, overall, we were both thoroughly impressed and would definitely recommend it to any NYC visitor who is on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was quite frankly the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Had we not arrived so late in the evening we would've moved on to a different hotel. The room was awful, with hairs and blood specks on the sheets and pillows, ancient broken furniture and a mould on the ceiling and walls; the staff were rude and spoke very little English; we shared a bathroom with seven other rooms, two of which were inhabited by large families with children whose crying and screaming did not stop through the night; corridors were dark, damp and smelly; lifts were not working. I implore you please never to stay at this dirty hell hole. Not even as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Better than everyone says”
Reviews.Author: Ells4
Reviews.Content: Booked up this hotel before reading the reviews, and was quite worried about what we would find when we got there. But were quite surprised, the staff were friendly and helpful. OK so the room wasn't 5 stars but thats not we were after, just somewhere to sleep. Which is all we planned to do, after all who goes to a city like New York and spends all their time in their hotel room. The room was clean and had a mirror which some people moaned about the rooms not having. The bathroom was clean and was right next door to our room, which is closer than the one in my house. I don't know where the people who gave bad reviews stayed but it wasn't the same place we did. If you want somewhere cheap and just a place to sleep then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in december. I didn't read these reviews before booking. Afterwards I read all these bad reviews and I was sorry for booking such a place. But... this isn't a bad hotel. You can not expect a 5 star luxury resort for this price. But I've stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world and this one is really beautifull. Nice rooms, good bathroom, satellite tv,... Very friendly staff. I don't know why everybody says it is so bad, it totally isn't. I think other hotels pay to write bad reviews. IT'S a really beautifull Hotel and I can recommend it to everyone. So don't let the reviews stop you from going.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting and Repulsive!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where the hotel got their pictures on their Web site because it was hardly what we thought we were getting ourslves into. It had a horrible smell, sheets were gross, no alarm clock, no phone, just a nightstand with a TV (no remote), no mirror, carpet was dirty, shared bathroom was nasty! Shower nozzles were coming out of the wall, the shower door didn't open or close all the way. I took a bunch of pictures. Take a look!

Reviews.Title: “disgusted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in middle of night so had to stay. Room dirty, stained and used sheets, cold, really bad odour, broken lock on door, shared filthy toilet. Didnt even want to clean our teeth, had to get out a.s.a.p. We were out at 7.30am to find somewhere else quickly. Brochure says basic, but very overpriced for a hovel. Keep away!

Reviews.Title: “sleazy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pribislav
Reviews.Content: We went there for one night and even this was to much. You have to go through the basement of the entrance to get to another house and thats where you "room" is. Ok, its a hostel so the rooms are not very large but this was realy small for two persons. A could turn around but thats it. The sheets of the beed were dirty as well. But the worst were the corridor and the bath room/toilett. It smelled like a public toilett which wasn't cleaned for weeks. I wouldn't have dared to take a shower in these bath room. I have seen many hostels in many regions of the world but this was one of the scary ones. And considering whar you get for the money it isn't even cheap. Pay 20 bucks extra and you will find a much nicer hotel where you feel save and you can take a shower without the need to desinfect yourself afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Positive review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after all the reviews i read i was really scared. but we found a nice hotel. the rooms/bathrooms were clean and our floor was very calm. you get what you pay for this category and its fair, the subway is around the corner and the surrounding is nice and safe. we enjoyed. don't trust this spoiled and world-innocent comments.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really, don't even think about staying here. The room was cold, the door didn't close fully, no mirrors anywhere (not in our room nor the dingy bathroom down the hall). I have NO idea where the hotel took the pictures that are readily available, it really does not look like that at all. Only stay if you like gray towels, hairy sheets, and sleeping in an inhospitable prison cell.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whether a hotel or a hostel, this place is terrible. A hostel can be basic, but you expect everything to function and to be clean. Not even a hook in the room to hang up a towel or a chair to put your clothes on when you take them off at night. The only place to put something was on the filthy floor. I know it's cheap, but cheap is no excuse for dirty. There are other hostels which are basic AND cheap AND clean. Under no circumstance does this dump qualify as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: esilva
Reviews.Content: Even if its a hotel or a hostel that doesn't matter the place is terrible. The blankets in our room were dirty, and the bed with almost a hole in the middle. Even if you want this hostel just for sleep take care because you can find some fleas in your room!. Avoid this hostel if you want a nice trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: like some other reviewers, i think it's all about expectations. i read these reviews after it was too late to cancel our booking, and i was expecting horrors. when i finally saw the room it was fine - just incredibly basic. we had a double room with shared bath (no. 530). our room had clean sheets, the shower worked well (hot water) and i only queued for the shared bathroom once. Must admit i bought cheap new pillows and a spongy mattress cover (for a total of US$30) but even with that added onto the room rate it was still cheaper than most other hotels. the location was fab, really close to subway downtown and the upper west side has great character. the mount royal is an old hotel in need of renovation, but i do believe it's good value for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: robdriessen
Reviews.Content: New York hotels are expensive. This hotel is relatively cheap for New York. You don't pay that much, but you get a bad hotel. Everything is old and not very clean. Unless you ask for, they do not renewal the towels. The rooms are small and no luxury. I would have chosen for a bit more expensive hotel, with normal rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It's lame, but it's cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked the mount royal hotel because we had no choice. our agents in the UK could find us nothing in NY for the dates we were going, due to UN conference week and NY fashion week. however, this was suggested and it was dirt cheap (Dirt being, as we came to find out, an aptly descriptive word for this hotel.) new york was hot and humid when we arrived (mid september) and the hotel has no a/c. the large fan in what was our small room just about did the job. the room was sufficiently tidy but the bathroom was absolutely filthy. we paid $100 extra for our own private bathroom for 5 nights, i.e $20 a night. this seemed worth it because we didn't want to share, but the bathroom was tiny (barely room to manouevre) and filthy. mildew and grime everywhere. you didn't want your arms to touch the walls.we asked for it to be cleaned and it was but even after a scrub it still looked disgusting - "it's an old hotel" laughed the caretaker. you bet it is. i might add that the upper west side is a great part of NY. it's a nice escape from the madness of midtown. the riverside is a 30 second walk from the hotel and it's great to relax there at night-time. midtown is 10/15 minutes by subway, and the station is a few minutes walk from the hostel. it's on 96th street which i thought would be well out of the action but it's not that far at all, bearing in mind that manhattan is a fairly small island. hotels in new york are problematic in that you have to pay big bucks to get anything moderately nice. we were two guys who just wanted to see NY, so this was sufficient and tolerable, despite it's drawbacks. but if you want to spend time in your hotel unwinding after a day out etc. then don't bother - the rooms are small, beds are metal and there's no room to relax. i would not want to stay here again and would only do so very reluctantly. if you are desperate for manhattan accomodation, on a tight budget and purely just want a place to stay then it's ok i guess. just make sure you bring your flip flops for the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Scandalous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mount Royal Hotel, New York City When we travelled to New York, we thought a basic hotel with a double bed and a shower would be good enough for our four-night-stay. We found the Mount Royal Hotel. It has only one star, but seemed to be ok. Check-in-time in New York is 3 PM so we were lucky to get a room earlier, it had just been cleaned. The room had: a double bed, two bedside tables, one chair and a TV (what we did not need); it had no wardrobe, no table, no rails or hooks to hang or dry anything, no shelf to put the toiletry, no rubbish bin. The shower/toilet was so tiny there was no room to put a toilet roll (it would have become wet anyway) and no rails either. I immediatly went down to the reception and asked for a better room and was told that this was one of their best ones. My husband and I have stayed in backpackers and youth hostels a lot and know what to expect as basic. That hotel does not deserve even one star - and not the name hotel - especially not for US $ 149.00 week-nights and US $ 193.00 saturday-nights. We did not want to spoil our holidays with that hotel and went to search for another one and luckily found one nearby were we could move in the next day. We would not recommend that hotel to anyone! Doris Petersen

HotelInfo.Name: Mount Royal Hotel & Hostel
HotelInfo.Address: 315 West 94th Street, New York City, NY 10025
